ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Continuation of American Sign Language-- more focus on signing independently
I gained a stronger foundation in ASL and feel much more comfortable in conversations only using ASL.
I learned a lot about the vocabulary and structure of ASL, as well as Deaf culture.
I learned a lot more vocabulary, and gained confidence in my conventional ability and signing fluency. I also learned a lot about deaf culture and things that are important to the deaf community.
I learned a lot about deaf and hard of hearing culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved everything about this course and think it was structured exceptionally.

The daily meetings are very productive and helpful in giving us the time and space to practice and build our skills, and there is a wide range of approaches and resources that are used to facilitate our learning. I think it would be helpful to have more guidance for our projects earlier on in the semester.
The strength of this course was definitely Professor Fisher. He was an amazing instructor.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. ASL is a unique language in that it addresses social and cultural issues that are especially relevant in America today. This course is taught and led by deaf and hard of hearing instructors, who have unique experiences of being deaf/HOH that enrich the learning environment.
I really would. The ASL program is incredible and all of the professors are truly wonderful.

I absolutely would recommend this class to any student. Its one of the best classes I have taken at Yale, and I know Ill carry the information Ive learned from this class with me for the rest of my life. I think it is important for everyone to know at least some ASL, and this class is so enjoyable, interesting, and informative. If someone wanted to learn a lot while having fun every day, I would encourage them to take this class.

yes, taking ASL is the greatest choice I made. It is a beautiful language that changes how you think about the world. It is unlike any other language and its challenges are unique. Signing is satisfying, engaging, and fun to put it simply. Learning ASL will be the best choice you make.
